Reviews.Title: “2nd time at this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cucuchi
Reviews.Content: I was here again in November 2011, this time with my husband; we came to visit our daughter that lives in Barcelona now. The hotel staff was very helpful and gaves us an upgrade, our room was again a corner room and we had a view to Las Ramblas; the room however was not noisy, I think they have soundproof rooms! Beds are very comfortable! The rooms are large and modern. The bathroom is quite modern and has a separate double shower spa-like setting! There is free WIFi in the room. There is also a computer on every floor with free WIFI you can use, in case you forgot your computer. The buffet breakfast again was great!, I love to sit outside in the balcony and see people walking by in Las ramblas while I sip my coffee! Location is great, a few steps from the Metro Liceu, La Boqueria market, and of course across from the great Liceu Opera House! Loved the walking tours in Barcelona at Travel Bar!

Reviews.Title: “All the reveiws are lies - don't waste your money here”
Reviews.Author: K B
Reviews.Content: This "hotel" is not even as good as a hostel. If you chose a 'basic' room (at about $200 a night!) you will get a closet sized utilitarian room with no phone, no access to an ironing board, dirty floors, and a litany of other disgusting issues. The photos they show on the website are for the highest priced room ONLY and that room only comes with two twin beds pushed together. All other rooms do not have any decoration let alone anything close to what the website shows. I had to complain forcefully to get an upgrade. I am sitting in the 'superior' room right now and it has a stench similar to urine cakes. The floors are dusty and the bathroom wall has hair stuck to the tiles. I have switched rooms twice now and the issues are the same. Don't expect to take a nap when you get here either. There is a constant pounding, scraping, and other banging noises going on without pause. The location is great but the stench is nauseating. DO NOT RENT IN THIS "HOTEL"

Reviews.Title: “Good place to watch the craziness unfold”
Reviews.Author: fatcontroller1999
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is very pleasant. staff friendly, rooms big enough and clean, decent breakfast, free water and wifi, nice roof terrace overlooking the ramblas, 24 hour security. Location wise, it is very centrally located on the rambles, close to the fantastic boqueria (indoor market) and plenty of good places to eat. The downsides of the hotel are actually nothing to do with the hotel at all, just the fact that it is on the rambles, which is home to some of the most inventive thieves in Europe, particularly noticeable in the evening. I have never been to Barcelona without hearing of someone getting mugged or robbed in some way. You should be ok if you are aware of this, hold on tight to your stuff and don't go wandering around drunk on your own at night. To stress again, this is nothing to do with the hotel, just the Ramblas area in general in the evening. It is actually quite entertaining seeing the world go by on the Ramblas at night from the safety of the hotel roof terrace. Don't let this put you off though, Barcelona is a beautiful place full of incredible architecture, art and food...

Reviews.Title: “Will be back”
Reviews.Author: KXX
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights during a conference. Location, room, and service all were close to perfect. The hotel is located more or less in the middle of La Rambla. It is a 5-10 minutes walk from Plaza Catalunya where the airport bus stops. There is a Metro stop right outside. Walking to the Fira convention center takes less than 30 minutes. The old town around the hotel has lots of great bars and restaurants. The room was large with a view of both La Rambla and some side streets. Despite facing La Rambla it was very quiet. The hotel seems newly renovated. It is quite stylish and has relatively high quality materials. The service was great, from check-in through bar service to check-out. The free wifi is good and there are computers available for use. All in all a very good hotel. Will be my choice in Barcelona for future trips.

Reviews.Title: “3 Star - Just”
Reviews.Author: sndie
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 stay night( Sat, Sun) stay.The location is superb, just a 10 min walk from the Plaza Cataluyna aerobus and hop on off bus stops.Metro station just over the road and everyting at hand.We were offered an Ramblas view room although small was clean and warm. Noise was not a problem but I think it is very low season.We took breakfast at local bars which were a lot cheaper.This Hotel is ideal for the first time visitor as it is in the centre, the only problem is where to eat , so much choice and not as expensive as I had feared.We paid arround £100 for 2 nights

Reviews.Title: “Great location Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: whitewingsUsa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel mid December for one night just before a cruise. Chose it as we could easily walk from Plaza Cataluyna, where the airport bus stops and then walk down Las Ramblas to the port bus. Hotel was better than expected. All refurbished to a high standard, very modern and sparkling clean with great decor. The room was small with very little storage space. Of course this didn't bother us as we were only there one night. Would be tricky if we'd have been there for several days and wanted to unpack. For a two or three days no problem. Bathroom was more spacious with a very large shower. Bedding lovely - comfortable. Check in quick and easy. Has elevator. Stored our luggage for day after checkout. We were in a front room, 3rd floor overlooking Las Ramblas - no noise from street, but obviously it is less busy in winter. Our room overlooked the Miro mosiac on the pavement below. We did not eat breakfast there as plenty of places on Las Ramblas. So convenient for tourist stops - famous food market almost opposite the hotel. Plaza Cataluyna with buses going to most of Gaudi spots a five minute walk away. We would definately return to this hotel. In fact we were sorry we were only there one night.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: mistermark8
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in the perfect location on in the Las Ramblas district. One of my most favorite hotels during our European tour. It was updated and modern and felt clean. The internet was fast, the hotel staff were nice, the balconies and tall rooms felt great. The shower was always hot and consistent and the televisions had more than 3 channels. I would definitely stay here again. The hotel staff were also nice enough to keep our baggage on hold until our flight for a few hours after we checked out. This hotel is very comfortable and try and go up to the rooftop terrace to enjoy the skyline views of Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “OK for one night”
Reviews.Author: CherrySlurpees
Reviews.Content: The hotel has great decor, but TINY rooms. There was barely enough space in the room for our luggage (2 people). We stayed only one night and would not have wanted to stay longer. We were cramped. The location is convenient for touristy things but the street activity didn't die down until about 5 am, so if you stay at this hotel be sure to pack some ear plugs. Also, their Internet doesn't have enough bandwidth for the guests. I was finally able to get online around 1:30 am. The staff is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: John H
Reviews.Content: Room was very small. Did not contain either a chair to sit on or a mirror. When we arrived the shower head was not fixed to the wall. When advised of the problem next day it was fixed to our satisfaction. The room was to the rear of the Hotel and overlooked a narrow alleyway that was frequented by drunks, drug snorters and vagabonds. It was very noisy as the echoes rebounded. The staff at reception and the housekeepers did a very good job nd were really friendly and helpful. The hotel was ideally situated with metro and bus stops nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, Location ideal for tourists”
Reviews.Author: Peter M
Reviews.Content: Very smart and indeed "cool" decor, Comfortable beds and right in the heart of things, but double glazing ensures quiet at night. Modest reception to be sure but friendly and helpful staff. Breakfast very good value also. Two tiny improvements would make it perfect. Waste paper bin minute - was virtually uselessly too small. Also no English speaking satellite TV. I know that we are in Spain, and when in Spain etc, but I'm talking icing on the cake here.

Reviews.Title: “Noisey Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bailliejk
Reviews.Content: Currently at the hotel room 104 & 102. Yes, this hotel is on La Rambles and we expected the outside noise from the road and walking by traffic which can be cancelled out by use of the air conditioning. But, what we did not expect was the level of hotel noise. The hallways are in marble...pretty but makes for a very noisey hotel. People wearing high heels echo in the hallways. On night at 12:15AM they where rolling a beer keg down the hallway! Lots of slamming doors! Scrapping back chairs from the computer center and breakfast room. Recommende if you stay here bring ear plugs. Also, flashing fire alarm above the bed tht flashes every 7 seconds. Rooms are done in a very modern fashion which is nice and rooms have laminent floors...which make for easy maintenance.The bed is a in wooden box frame sticking out in the room that my husband and I kept barking are shins on. TV in room only gets 4 channels. Huge shower on suite...nice after being on a cruise ship that have small shower stalls. Finally, the bed...hard and umcomfortable....if I had not booked this hotel through expedia and would not get my money back after the first night I would have found a different hotel for my family. Breakfast with room is adequate and filling. No lounged area to just sit and read a book or paper. Would have liked to had a refrigerator in the room to have bottled water or soda chilled. Hotel does not have a bar or resturant.

Reviews.Title: “Best location”
Reviews.Author: TallinnKadi
Reviews.Content: Its just very good location.Couldnt be better.Our room was very quiet.Good airconditioner. Rooms are clean and not too small.Just fine for 2 adult and 2 big luggage.Very friendly retception stuff ,we rented a bikes and allways they helped us to take our bikes to the basement.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: egreg44
Reviews.Content: Attractive (underutilised) breakfast room, well regulated airconditioning and quiet (as requested), but....We arrived late on a Saturday night, La Rambla was packed with drunken, noisy tourists and the Reception area was a bit seedy. Not a good introduction. In our room (supposedly a Superior Double), our bathroom was a frosted-glass cubicle in the entry hall and the basin was actually in the hall. No shelves for toothbrush/cosmetics, etc. Only one bedside lamp for 2 of our 4 day stay (3 requests), double doors opened onto a brick wall and the room was tiny, no space for my husband and I to pass eachother at the foot of the bed and no space for a chair. The lounge areas of the hotel were small and uncomfortable, so there was really nowhere to go if you just wanted to sit and read a book for an hour. Staff good and bad. Laundry prices exhorbitant. Outside common deck was always untidy, with cushions missing and broken umbrellas. Comparatively reasonably priced, but not good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: Cucuchi
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very good, front desk staff was very helpful. Hotel rooms were large and modern, bathrooms was very large, the room we stayed was a corner unit and had a separate shower roo. We had Wifi in the room, including a free computer we could use; plus there was Wifi free in every floor. The air conditioning and soundproof rooms were great! being right at Las Ramblas and steps away from the Liceu Metro was great too! The beds were really comfortable! The breakfast was excellent! and there is a nice balcony where you can have your breakfast looking to Las Ramblas street! Really great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic gem in heart of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: davemaz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in July in basic standard room- it was basic but very clean and modern- arrived at 9pm and checked out at 11am so not bothered about superior room. Hotel location is fantastic and staff are really nice and friendly- I got impression it is family run. Sandra was very helpful and as I was going on a cruise asked if I could leave my luggage for the day in two weeks time - they said yes with no charge. Breakfast was really good hot and cold choice. Hotel's decor is very modern I could not believe it was only 3 stars it should be 4. loved it so much I cancelled my hotel for August and stayed again at this hotel. This time I had superior room over looking las Ramblas , it was amazing, electrics were a little dodgy but it is Spain! You can tell difference in room type by door key, superior rooms have a electronic card, standard have a key and no view! Bathroom was very luxurious in superior room- honestly I've stayed in much worse 5 star hotels. Everytime I visit Barcelona I will stay at this hotel now, location is perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovley little hotel”
Reviews.Author: katekipper
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights at the International Cool Hotel last week and it was lovely. This is probably my 10th visit to Barcelona and the International Cool Hotel is by far the best hotel I have stayed in and wonderful value for money. The hotel is located on La Rambla, approximately middle to lower end, right opposite the Liceu Opera Theatre. If you didn’t want to make the 5 minute walk from Placa de Catalunya to the hotel then you could disembark the Metro directly outside! Although the entranced to the hotel is discreet once we entered the glass lift to our floor you see the full scope of the light, airy and contemporary hotel. We had a twin room, it was lovely and clean with simple modern decorations, a beautiful little bathroom (well it was a shower room really as there was no bath) and double doors opening on to the neighbouring side street with a view to the left of La Rambla. Even if the room was a little small by some people’s standards I feel that in this price range I would rather have the nice modern surroundings than bags of floor space. The bed was extremely comfortable and the towels were nice and soft and in the bathroom there was a good hairdryer and the usual complementary bits and pieces. Breakfast is served on the first floor in a gorgeous room over looking La Rambla. They had a good selection of meats, cheeses, fruits, cereal and some delicious pastries. They also offered scrambled eggs, bacon, fried potatoes and cooked tomatoes, all very good. It was the attention to detail that really impressed me with this hotel not only with the décor and furnishings but the laptop computers dotted around with free internet access and the complimentary drinks cupboards on the landings of each floor, all really nice touches. My final comment is for the street bar located on the Rambla, this is owned by the hotel and it only added to our experience. The bar tender Ramon worked tirelessly to tend all of his guests whilst going back and forth to the bar on the first floor. This really is a great spot to relax and enjoy a beer. I would definitely stay at this hotel again in fact I look forward to it!

Reviews.Title: “Not so cool”
Reviews.Author: stig56
Reviews.Content: Good location,very small rooms,looks better in computer than in actually size. Maybee good for business man/woman.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit here, great location”
Reviews.Author: Fiona L
Reviews.Content: This time, we were just having a flying visit as we were stopping the night before an early flight in the morning, but we have been here before and really can't fault this hotel. The staff are always friendly, the rooms comfortable and the location is perfect. Yes, if you're a very light sleeper, you might want to avoid it because it's right slap bang on Las Ramblas, but for us, that's the charm of the place. We don't find it overly loud, as mentioned in some other reviews, but there is a buzz to the area that can go on until the small hours - I advise getting out there and enjoying it! The rooms come with a free "mini bar", which (unfortunately) contains only soft drinks, but that's a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “NOISE! NOISE! NOISE!”
Reviews.Author: cjgdj
Reviews.Content: Yes it has the ideal location! But thars where it all ends unfortunately...i have stayed in a much better 1* hotel in Seville than this glorified HOSTAL.....my tip would be to book a 4* 5-10 mins off La Rambla which i did 2 yrs ago for a cheaper price & regret not doing this time! GOOD!>>> Location on Las Rambla BAD!>>>>Shower (no bath) only has curtain, which couldnt stop the water from overflowing all over the floor! £103 for room! (Luckily i paid £78..which is still too much!) UGLY! >>>Poky Room 112 (8 ft by 8ft aprox) Backing on to very noisy Alley, windows are NOT soundproofed (as mentioned on website!) & don't even Lock! Barely slept a wink, as continual drunks/prostitutes/drug dealers passing by & shouting very loudly! Next door i could hear snoring ALL night! & chefs can be heard in morning shouting etc too! also no remarks on how our stay was upon checking out! Travel tip: Go to Olympic village marina for Lunch, lots of restaurants too choose from...We stumbled on La Ronda & we each had a 4 course meal + bread & olives plus i had a bottle of red to myself!!! (I had to leave half!) , wife had a beer & then coffee included!....ALL for €10 EACH!!!! AMAZING! & decent food with busy pleasant atmosphere!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: don_legend
Reviews.Content: Great location on Las Ramblas. Very lively. The hotel itself is very clean. Rooms are decent sized. The lobby of the hotel is very small and you can sometimes miss the entrance. The staff are friendly and very approachable. Stayed here with my wife and 1 year old son. Would recommened it!!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended- great in so many ways.”
Reviews.Author: tunefultiger
Reviews.Content: Great location in the centre of Las Ramblas, immediately outside Metro Liceu. Our superior double had a window in the middle of the hotel looking down onto an indoor courtyard, as such, which gave us a peaceful night's sleep from the busyness of Las Ramblas but was also very secure. The contemporary room had a lovely bed and bathroom, very clean and comfortable. The only negative was the lack of air-conditioning as the hotel had not changed it yet from the seasonal heating but were most apologetic. We enjoyed spending time on the hotel roof terrace after walking miles each day. It had great views and nice seating areas and it was wonderful to have a complimentary cold drink on our return. Free wifi was also excellent and there was a laptop on every floor should you need access to one. Breakfast was most enjoyable each morning with varied selections of juice, ham, cheese, cereal and fruits. There was also a choice of coffees and pastries which we liked to take out to have on the narrow balcony overlooking the Ramblas. On our last day the hotel kindly looked after our bags until later in the day. All staff were friendly and efficient. We stayed for four nights and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible arrangement”
Reviews.Author: zizou6969
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel via booking.com, when I arrived to this hotel they didn´t find my booking, we were put in Husahotels nearby. I didn´t see Ramblas as it was promised in my booking and didn´t have minibar included in the price, as it was promised. Wanna know what promise they kept: price was the same, of course.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wip_11
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with International Cool Local Hotel mainly due to its location. We booked the superior room with Rambla view so we had a balcony overlooking the Rambla and the Liceu which was wonderful. We didn't hear the street noise during the night due to the windows, however we did hear the noise made by the cleaning ladies in the morning. Our room had a door to connect to the room next to ours. For the first 2 nights we were lucky because there was nobody in the next room. The last night was quite bad as the people in the next room were very noisy. The breakfast was wonderful, with various types of cheese, salami, cereals, fruits, yoghurt, eggs and sausages, coffee and fresh juice. The hotel staff was not so helpful, but we managed to get the information on the internet as the hotel has laptop and internet connection on each floor. I noticed some people mentioned that there was no mini bar in the room. However there was a refrigerator on each floor with bottles of water, Coca Cola and other juices. And free of charge. I will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for money!”
Reviews.Author: livnat
Reviews.Content: The hotel is modern and the stuff do all they can to help you with friendly smile. The hotel manager is always around and takes good care of everything. It is perfectly located in the heart of the Ramblas just in front of the famous market. Best value for money!

Reviews.Title: “A nice experience”
Reviews.Author: isaHolanda
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a wonderful holiday in Barcelona. We stayed at the "Hotel Cool Internacional". This hotel has many names, but at the entrance you will find the name "Cool Internacional". The hotel is completely renewed. The beds are very confortable. The room is small but it has space enough for your stuff. We had a room with balcony to the Rambla. There you can see all the action in town. In front of the hotel is the Metro station Liceu. You can get the aerobus at the airport and then at Plaza Catalunya take the train, line green, to Liceu. We got a cab from the airport because we didn't know our way to the hotel, we paid 25 euros. In the bus is just 5.05 euros plus the metro. The location of the hotel is great you can reach many touristic places walking. The only thing that was not 100% perfect was that they don't provide you bottled water on your room, and the tub water tastes very bad. Also that eggs and bacon at breakfast were not warm. The breakfast is very decent but the fact that the warm food is not warm was not fine. If you go to Barcelona, you should stay here. It is very nice. Oh, and it has an elevator. I read a review that said that they didn't have an elevator, but they have one. Have fun in Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Good 3 star hotel, would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: sophiev77
Reviews.Content: Great location, great price. Nice breakfast. Rooms small but very clean and modern and all we wanted from a barcelona hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Right on La Rambla”
Reviews.Author: Green-eyed-77
Reviews.Content: Used it before our Cruise. Was perfect what we needed. Right down town....very nice place.... cleane and a place to sleep. great service. Not a 5* but not a 2*...is what it is...but was perfect

Reviews.Title: “Best spot on the Ramblas for a city break”
Reviews.Author: Danyweber
Reviews.Content: This hotel has just been renewed and it now looks like a very modern one with a great design. The room was very clean with nice design decoration. Even though you're on the Ramblas, the windows have a very good isolation which allows you to sleep very well. The full hotel seems to pay a tribute to the May 68 events in France which seems confusing at first, but which then gives its "cool" spirit to the whole building. Breakfast is good, with fruits, eggs & bacon, cheese, yogurt bread, and cereals. If you're looking for a good value for money hotel, on the Ramblas and in front of the Liceu Theatre then this is definitely the one to choose. We had booked a superior room with view on the Ramblas for 130Euros a night, including breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for Anybody Without Huge Demands”
Reviews.Author: snowmons1
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel - pretty good for tourists without big demands and expectations: strong positive featurs: - excellent location: exact culture historical center, pass the service road and you can drop into metro (subway), - hotel after total renovation - clean and new, - room with AC, - acceptable, good breakfast incl. juces, espresso, muesly, yogurt, fresh fruits, james, baguettes, sausages and cheese - enough for morning - of course all fresh! - free internet incl. a few laptops (several not working), - good room service. negative features: - small room , noise from the street and transportation, you should to sleep with closed balkony door, otherwise each word being said in the walking bulevard belongs to your ears. - no minibar in the room for case you wish to drink a something cooled drink. - no chear in the room, - I've recieved two separate beds instead of we are couple, - several laptops does not work (no internet connectivety), Overall: if you don't look for five stars, but ONLY for staying the night and all the time walking in Barcelona - this is a good option.

Reviews.Title: “You will not have the energy for Barcelona if you stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: Memouk
Reviews.Content: The rooms are tiny, the view we had was into the hotel cavety looking down into a pit of rubbish, there was no natural light coming into the room, which generally meant we overslept. The beds were very uncomfortable, so sleep was very disturbed (probably another reason for sleeping in). The air con wasn't working so we had to keep the pit window open all the time. Couldn't relax in the room at all so it felt like we spent the whole 5 days on our feet. On a plus, the location is great. I really regret not booking into the HUSA Oriental instead, which is on Las Ramblas the same, but a little closer to the harbour. I also found it at a cheaper rate! (It's a 4 star instead of 1), and looked much nicer (I haven't actually stayed there though!).

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: LukeIreland
Reviews.Content: Everything was ok, except broken a/c. In our room was extremely hot -hard to sleep .Perfect localization, helpfull staf, just refurbished, laptops with free internet on every floor, spacious lift.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but that is the only positive”
Reviews.Author: Kristin862
Reviews.Content: Husa was not a great experience for my friend and I. It was extremely NOISY until early in the morning, the air did NOT work, really small rooms, and NO elevators. Not only were these issues but the receptionist at the front desk called a taxi for us but failed to let us know that there was going to be an extra 10 euro charge because she called for us. While she didn't speak much English she still could have told us in Spanish or something. This was annoying and a bad way to end our trip in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer Beware!”
Reviews.Author: ccosgrove
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Husa Internacional Hotel on April 30th and May 1st. The location is right on Las Ramblas and is very convenient. It is very noisy (if you have a room on the street) until about 5 am! We had three rooms at the hotel. It was very clean but there were no elevators and there are no rooms on the ground floor! Dragging your luggage up the various levels of stairs is a real pain. While we were there the staff was very polite and professional however after being home for one month Visa has advised us that there have been charges on our card in the last couple of days. This hotel is the only place that we used our Visa card in Spain! So be careful about what information you give them if you decide to stay there!

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, very clean, staff very nice and friendly”
Reviews.Author: green54
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are just back from a stay in Barcelona. We stayed in the Internacional Hotel and it was so perfect for us. It is right in the middle of the La Rambla and so convienent to everything. The staff were so nice and friendly and the place was so clean. There was no breakfast at the Hotel but we bought a voucher from them and we were able to have Breakfast in one of the other Hotels accross the Street. It was a buffet Breakfast and it was fantastic for just a little over €7.00 each per Morning. Our room was a bit on the small side but that did not bother us really The Hotel is so near to everything and the buzz on the La Rambla is super. The Harbour is just about 5 mis walk from the hotel and a lot of the beautiful places to visit are within walking distance. Of course I being a person who loves to shop was in my eliment because all of the Shops were around me. The Weather was just beautiful. We will go back to Barcelona again and we will definately stay in the Internacional Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean, and ideally located”
Reviews.Author: Milady-London
Reviews.Content: We are just back from our 3 days in Barcelona. As our first time there, we wanted a hotel centrally located... and this one is perfect for that... right in the middle of La Rambla, with the metro stop Liceu right in front of the hotel, it makes visit much easier. Round the corner, the Gothic quarter starts, 5mins walk down La Rambla to be by the sea, 5 mins walk the other way to be at Placa de Catalunya... (ideal for transport to/from the airport). The hotel was clean, the staff at reception nice and helpful. The room was small, yes... but reasonably small, and clean which is more important... Only downside for people with reduced mobility, there is no lift, but that was OK for us... nothing to complain about, really. especially for the price: 154 euros for 2 nights right in the city centre.... I would definitely recommend and stay there again for my next trip to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: gelatoisyummy
Reviews.Content: We only stayed for one night, but were satisfied with the hotel. Very small room but nicely updated. Nicely updated bathroom as well. Both were nice and clean. Only one tiny little window looking into a courtyard. We forgot to set our alarm clock and overslept because no light came into our room to indicate it was morning yet. Perfect location right on the Ramblas. Would stay here again for the location alone! Nice stay overall.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs!”
Reviews.Author: SanSevero
Reviews.Content: This is very much a 1* hotel, as another reviewer said the reception is clean and smart, however, the rooms are tiny, dirty, smelly, basic. The door to the room hardly closes, let alone locks. I had a T.V and fan; however, the wires were wrapped around the table leg and then trailed along the floor across the room to the nearest plug. Extremely unsafe as this was right next to the door to the tiny bathroom! The hotel breakfast was ok, again this room was quite smart, the location is great - bang on in the middle of la ramblas, this is the only plus point. I would only recommend this to young travellers who are happy with a very basic, central (and noisy) place for the night. Everyone else avoid and try somewhere further out of the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible hotel service and construction noise”
Reviews.Author: Travelin'Thuls
Reviews.Content: The Husa International does not understand the concept of customer service in the least bit. When I questioned a charge on our bill, I was given an argumentative and threatening response by their reception personnel (and I work for a four-star hotel.) In addition, there is MAJOR street construction taking place in front of the hotel and we were awoken by concrete drilling. We did not receive any apologies or offered any reconciliation for the inconvenience. I would never stay at this property again.

HotelInfo.Name: Internacional cool local hotel
HotelInfo.Address: C/ Ramblas 78-80, 08001 Barcelona, Spain (Formerly Husa Internacional Hotel)
